EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop at (x=0.5, y=20.5)

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research – now reconnected to the Electric Pole at (x=16.5, y=13.5) via an updated Electricity Group.
• Electricity Group comprising multiple small electric poles at positions including (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5), (x=1.5, y=22.5) and additional ones at (x=-10.5, y=18.5), (x=-11.5, y=18.5), (x=-12.5, y=16.5).
• Steam Engines:
 – Primary engine at (x=-13.5, y=16.5)
 – Additional engines at (x=-14.5, y=13.5), (x=7.5, y=35.5) and (x=8.5, y=20.5)
• Fluid System Submodule – Boiler Module comprising:
 – Pre-existing Boiler at (x=-13.5, y=19.0) with intermediate pipe at (x=-17.5, y=21.5) (fluid connection failed).
 – Existing new Boiler+Steam Engine Pair originally placed with boiler at (x=-14.0, y=16.5) then repositioned to (x=-10.0, y=22.5) with its associated steam engine at (x=-7.5, y=11.5) (connection unresolved).
 – Additional attempted Boiler+Steam Engine Pair with boiler at (x=-7.0, y=23.5) and steam engine at (x=1.5, y=28.5) (pipe connection unresolved).
 – NEW Boiler+Steam Engine Pair with boiler at (x=-2.0, y=15.5) and steam engine at (x=11.5, y=13.5) – now successfully connected with a PipeGroup (fluid_system=151295) comprising 61 pipes.

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) reconfigured for iron gear wheel production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=1.5, y=17.5).
• Input Chest at (x=2.5, y=17.5).
• Output Chest at (x=1.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-5.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=0.5, y=17.5).
• Additional Burner Inserters at (x=2.5, y=16.5) and (x=3.5, y=17.5).

### Copper Extraction System (adjacent to the copper smelting furnace)
Consists of:
• Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=23.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=22.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=24.5).
• Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-3.5, y=26.5).
• Chest Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=27.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=26.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=28.5).
• Belt Source Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=25.5).

### Extraction Belt Depot at position (x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt depot.
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=4.5, y=15.5) for copper plate conveyance.
• Depot Burner Inserter at (x=3.5, y=14.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=3.5, y=13.5).

### Belt Connection Target Setup for Copper Extraction
Consists of:
• Extraction Source: Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5).
• Extraction Inserter at (x=4.5, y=15.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=5.5, y=15.5).
• Manual Transport Belt Chain composed of horizontal and vertical segments.
• New Target Inserter at (x=8.5, y=9.5) with pickup at (x=8.5, y=10.5) and drop at (x=8.5, y=8.5).
• Belt Chain Burner Inserter Refueling Subsystem with burner inserters at various positions.

### Remote Fluid Integration System at remote region (approximate center: x=-30, y=40)
Consists of:
• Offshore Pump at (x=-30.5, y=37.5) (WORKING).
• Boiler for fluid heating at (x=-29.0, y=33.5).
• Pipe Connection established via a PipeGroup starting at (x=-30.5, y=31.5) and extending to (x=-30.5, y=34.5).
• New segmented pipe connection attempt aimed at linking the Offshore Pump with the New Boiler (targeted near x=-10.0, y=22.5) remains unresolved.

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Inventory Shortages and Crafting Prerequisites:
 – Ensure all required sub-ingredients (especially iron plates and coal) are available before initiating crafting actions. Repeated failures in crafting pipes and inserting coal indicate that insufficient resources can cascade into multiple operational errors.
 – Continuously monitor inventory levels to prevent crafting and placement attempts with missing items.

• Pipe Crafting and Fluid Connection:
 – Verify that the planned pipe connection has enough pipe items available. Multiple attempts to connect the Boiler at (x=-2.0, y=15.5) with the Steam Engine at (x=11.5, y=13.5) failed due to requiring 61 pipes while crafting batches yielded fewer items.
 – Harvest and smelt additional resources as needed to meet the minimum component requirements for large-scale pipe crafting.

• Electrical Network and Connection Management:
 – Confirm that the target positions for electric poles and network connections are unoccupied and supported by sufficient inventory. Reconnection of the Lab to the Electric Pole (now successfully at (x=16.5, y=13.5)) was achieved by addressing previous shortages.
 – Maintain accurate entity references to prevent connection failures related to missing or misdirected components.

• General Error Handling:
 – Validate computed buildable positions and pre-check that target tiles are free of obstructions.
 – Keep inventory records consistently updated after each crafting and placement attempt to avoid referencing unavailable resources.
